posts.title: Successfully changed live 2d widget
posts.text: I successfully changed live 2d widget to a cat (well the ideal for me is some mecha-stylled widget wwww). The next step is to add two of them, one on the right side and another on the left. First thing to do is to install the 2d widget helper: 1npm install --save hexo-helper-live2d Next, install the model that I wanted: hijiki the cat: 12usage: npm install {packagename}npm install live2d-widget-model-hijiki Then add the following code to the main ‚Äú_config.yml‚Äù file (not the ‚Äú_config.yml‚Äù of the theme): 123456789101112131415161718live2d: enable: true scriptFrom: local pluginRootPath: live2dw/ pluginJsPath: lib/ pluginModelPath: assets/ tagMode: false log: false model: use: live2d-widget-model-hijiki display: position: right width: 150 height: 300 mobile: show: true react: opacity: 1.0 Then everthing is normal.

posts.title: Maybe I found the reason of the incorrectness of the Safari tab favicon
posts.text: Soooo actually the safari tab favicon of newer pages is correct.<(ÔΩÄ^‚Ä≤)> Now I‚Äôm using Chrome. It is way better for web development! My explaination of the bad Safari favicon is: I don‚Äôt have that image in my local folders, hence the old favicon has to be stored in a Safari server. The favicon should be somehow ‚Äúassociated‚Äù to my blog‚Äôs link, so every time that some one opens my blog‚Äôs main page, Safari will put the icon stored in Safari‚Äôs server into user‚Äôs Safari tab icon. The old icon is not refreshed in the server end.When I create a new page, a new link is created. Then, the Safari‚Äôs server will store the correct favicon which is associated only to my new pages, but not the old ones.Solution: wait maybe one week or one month. Let‚Äôs see if the lazy Safari server refresh :/

posts.title: I give up
posts.text: Damn it. I have been working on this for say more than 4 hours, but the damn Safari favicon never changed at all. Where the fuck did the Safari get that old favicon? WHERE IS THAT GOD DAMN OLD IMAGE‚Äôs SOURCE FILE??? WHERE IS MY NEW IMAGE???The source code (index.html) says that everything is in its place. But the God Damn favicon didn‚Äôt refresh. Everyting is working on Chrome. The shortcut icon on Safari works perfectly. Why the stupid tab icon didn‚Äôt change? I already tried:1: Open my website at Private mode (Safari)2: Delete all Safari favicon cache that I found in this directory: 1~/Library/Safari/Favicon Cache/ 3: Restart computerNothing above worked!But the Chrome has everything CORRECT! Damn it.No more hexo for today. I was really happy when I can put image on my site in the afternoon, but now I‚Äôm kinda pissed off.Oh btw, it was quite boring typing ‚Äúhexo clean‚Äù, ‚Äúhexo g‚Äù and ‚Äúhexo d‚Äù. Not to mention the time that you have to wait between these commands. I found that this is a ‚Äúcompact version‚Äù of deploy command, it‚Äôs quite handy: 1hexo clean && hexo g --d
